result.execSummary:
The defendant John Edward Balistreri was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • 1st-Degree Reckless Homicide, a class B felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.02(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Provide a DNA sample for the data bank, pay all appropriate costs.
Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, and supervision fees or civil judgment will be entered.
All Court costs, fees, surcharges to be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extended Supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

superMiscConds.notes: Obtain HSED/GED.  Obtain and maintain employment and/or school  and/or vocational training.
Mental health evaluation. Take all prescribed medications.

No drugs or alcohol.
Do not frequent palces where alcohol or illegal drugs are sold, distributed or used.
No contact with known drug dealers.
No possession of drug paraphernalia.
No contact with the victim(s) family Clara B. and Mary N. or their residence without prior Court/agent approval. Any violation may result in additional charges.

Successfully complete anger management and continue programming.
Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
Cognitive intervention programming.
Trauma counseling.
Participate in alcohol and drug assessment. Successfully complete recommended treatment.  Maintain absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzer tests.

supervisions.notes: *3/9/2016  Honorable Ellen R. Brostrom-Term of Extended supervision commuted to 20 years.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor; also advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

per order dated June 6, 2017, Appeal No. 2017AP553-CR, IT IS ORDERED that Attonrey Leon W. Todd III, is relieved from any further representation of Balistreri in this matter.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the notice of no-merit appeal is converted to a direct appeal under Wis. Stat. Rule 809.30 (2015-16).  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, no later than June 28, 2017, Balistreri shall file a document in this court stating whether he wishes to proceed with the direct appeal, or whether he wishes to voluntarily dismiss the direct appeal and file a postconviction motion in the circuit court.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that, if Balistreri does not response to this order on or before June 28, 2017, his appellate brief and appendix shall be due in this court within sixty days of the date of this order.  IT IS FURTHER ORDERED that the public defender's report dated May 11, 2017, is accepted as filed.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant John Edward Balistreri in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John Edward Balistreri in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Statements made as to sentencing.  
AMENDED COUNT 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of 50 YEARS, with credit for 305 days time served; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 27 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 23 YEARS.  The defendant IS NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and IS NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
* Successfully complete Anger Management, and continue programming.
* Mental Health Evaluation and take all prescribed medications.
* Medically assisted treatment if appropriate.
* Cognitive intervention programming.
* Trauma counseling.
* Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment
   and successfully complete recommended treatment.
* Maintain absolute sobriety.  No drugs.  No alcohol.
* Random urine screens and breathalyzer test.
* DO NOT frequent places where alcohol or illegal drug are sold, distributed or used.
* No contact with known drug dealers.
* No possession of drug paraphenelia.
* No contact with the victim(s) family; Clara B. and Mary N. or their residence without prior court/agent approval.  Any violation may result in additional charges.	
* Obtain HSED/GED.
* Obtain and maintain employment and/or school and/or vocational training.
* Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges,
   and supervision fees or CIVIL JUDGMENT will be entered.

Defendant shall provide a DNA sample for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.  Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm or body armor.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  

The Court ordered that all court costs, fees, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.

 Filed,
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit;
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence.
Invoice forwarded to Account payable in the amount of $3,025.00 to Dr Gregory Van Rybroek for services on 07-06, 12, 19, 22, 26 -2015. Copy in file.

Defendant John Edward Balistreri not in court, defendant in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes is unable to  appear for the State of Wisconsin due to being in jury trial in Branch 15.  Attorney McCandless appeared by telephone  Deputy court clerk:  vk  Due to ADA Hayes being in jury trial court adjourned the sentencing in Branch 6.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for February 8, 2016 at 08:15 am.
from the Wisconsin State Public Defender, received and filed. lms
From Gregory J. Van Rybroek, Ph.D., J.D. dated November 23, 2015.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.
Court vacates the No contact order with Rudolph K.
Defense request modification of the No contact order and the cash bail.  Court grants request to modify the no contact order and denies modification of the cash bail.
Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Defendant John Edward Balistreri in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John Edward Balistreri in custody.  Karl Peter Hayes appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy court clerk: LMS.

Amended information, received and filed, dismissing the penalty enhancer USE OF DANGEROUS WEAPON, DOMESTIC ABUSE contrary to Wisconsin Statutes section(s) 939.63(1)(b) & 968.075(1)(a), a Class B misdemeanor.

Copy served on defendant.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of amended information, waives formal reading, momentarily pleads not guilty.

Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Addendum and Jury instruction received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Court found the defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information.  Judgment of conviction entered.  Defendant is advised he is a convicted felon and may not possess any firearms.  Defendant is advised he is unable to vote in any election until civil rights are restored.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  PSI was ordered.

Court vacates any future court dates.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for January 15, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant John Edward Balistreri not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant entersa plea of not guilty and not guilty by reason of mental disease or defect.  Court appoints Dr. Greg VanRybroek to perform NGI evaluation.  
Filed, signed Order for Examination under 971.16.
Case is adjourned for return on doctor's report, motion hearing, final pretrial conference and for jury trial in Branch 6.
Filed, signed Felony Pretrial Scheduling Order.  
All parties are notified that effective August  3, 2015 this case will be assigned to Judge Ellen Brostrom, Branch 6,  in Room 423 of the Safety Building.  Any right of substitution begins to run as of the date of receipt of this notice, unless notified by the court on an earlier date.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for August 10, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for November 2, 2015 at 10:00 am.

Attorney Victoria Mccandless in court, defendant John Edward Balistreri not in court, in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant's motion to adjourn not objected to by the State and granted by the Court.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference in Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant advised No Contact Order remains in full force and effect.
Bail motion by defense argued and denied by the Court.

Defendant John Edward Balistreri in court with attorney Victoria Mccandless.  Defendant John Edward Balistreri in custody.  Sara B. Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Milwaukee Police Department Detective Kent Corbett.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 10.  Scheduling conference scheduled for May 4, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.     No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  
Defendant to have no contact with: Melvin S;  Rudolph K.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant John Edward Balistreri in court with attorney Jeffry R Schwartz.  Defendant John Edward Balistreri in custody.  
Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dugan, Branch 10.  
Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  
Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings. 
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.

Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 24, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
